CatDescriptText: Mrs. Corinthia Smith, housewife, 3204 Dawson Street, was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, November 29, 1958, pg. A1 with question: "Do you think that taverns should be permitted to remain open past midnight on Saturdays?" answer reads: "I think that they should be open. It's up to the individual to know when to go home if he has to go to church in the morning."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Corinthia Smith, wearing coat with collar and head scarf, standing in front of Fanny Farmer Candies, Wood Street, Downtown
